DataElement.preferredName: Patient Advanced Malignant Neoplasm Prior Registration Eligibility Determination Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the indicator related to advanced cancer (a term for diseases in which abnormal cells divide without control) and the eligibility status of a patient or participant prior to registration or enrollment on a clinical trial, as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Advanced Malignant Neoplasm Prior Registration Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the advanced cancer, a term for diseases in which abnormal cells divide without control reproduction, status of a patient or participant prior to registration or enrollment on a clinical trial as an eligibility criterion for participation on a clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Advanced Malignant Neoplasm Prior Registration Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: Far along in course.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:Earlier in time or order.:Registration; the act of enrolling.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
The act of listing or recording officially; officially qualified or enrolled.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the indicator related to eligibility determinations.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Patient, as documented by the
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient, as documented by the treating physician, is clinically staged as one of the following: T4 a-c for whom modified radical mastectomy with negative margins is the goal T2 or T3 for whom conversion from needing mastectomy to breast conservation is the goal T2 for whom lumpectomy at first attempt is the goal

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a T2 or T3 primary tumor (N0-N3, M0), unresectable by radical vulvectomy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Disease determined unresectable or entailing unacceptably morbid surgery
